stories.text:
In the midst of the mass hysteria of Javascript and async-await mass psychosis the natural idea of returning back to the sanity of well-researched old-timer's languages (Lisp and ML families) faces so much hatred and rage.

However, most businesses applications and services can (and should) be done in mostly functional languages, operating on simple streams, while delegating everything to the system.

Yes, just Unix pipes and text streams all over again, but Haskell or Ocaml instead of C or C++.

https://karma-engineering.com/lab/wiki/Results4
stories.title: Ask HN: Why this is so difficult to grasp?

stories.text:
My kid can use a mobile phone for plenty of positive useful things, but can clearly not manage usage of youtube - it triggers plenty of addict-behaviour. I timebox her youtube access, and have blocked youtube in our firewall at home.
  Is there any feasible way to block youtube-access on an android? I can manually temporarily disable some services, but videos can stil be played indirectly, and she finds those holes.
It might be video-playing as such that must be blocked, but youtube is the major problem.
It's not the content subject that is the problem, it's their weaponized addictiveness.
stories.title: Ask HN: Configure Android phone to block YouTube?
